alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 27 at 4:08AM AKDT until March 28 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow and snow expected. Visibility as low as one half mile at times in blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches are possible, especially in the Portage Valley. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Turnagain Pass and the Portage Valley. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 1 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Winds will cause areas of blowing snow, significantly reducing visibilities. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strengthening frontal system will impact Turnagain Pass and the Portage Valley. Snow and blowing snow are initially expected due to cooler temperatures Sunday evening and Sunday night. However as slightly warmer air moves into the Portage Valley blowing snow will end by Monday morning with snow changing over to a rain-snow mix by the afternoon. Turnagain Pass is expected to stay cold enough for blowing snow conditions to persist through 1 PM Monday. Temperatures will then warm to near freezing Monday afternoon, which will end the threat of blowing snow. Though visibilities will improve, snow and elevated winds will continue across the region through Tuesday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
